abstract: Deferred prosecution agreements have become the norm for resolving investigations into misconduct by financial institutions, but their frequent use raises the question of whether banks have come to regard them as just another cost of doing business.

lead_paragraph: The global banking giant HSBC reached a settlement on Tuesday with the Justice Department and other federal agencies that requires the bank to pay about $1.9 billion and beef up its compliance measures.

headline.main: In Bank Settlements, Fines but No Accountability
